website_summaries.verdict: Trusted brand name in a brad nailer that will handle whatever kinds of jobs you have.
pros: Drives 18-gauge brad nails ranging from 0.625 to 2 inches
Tough and durable tool that requires little to no maintenance
Exhaust in the rear to keep it away from operator's face
Simple release mechanism requires no tools if nails jam
Easily adjustable nail depth and nail head setting
cons: Nail firing mechanism may seize up for some users, leaving tool inoperable

customer_reviews.title: ... lot of dewalt brand tools and they work as great most of the time and they are my preferred ...
customer_reviews.text: I own a lot of dewalt brand tools and they work as great most of the time and they are my preferred brand. This tool was no exception when I started using it. I like the overall function of this a lot better than my older bostitch one. The reason I'm giving this a 2 star is because the oring on the cylinder broke after 7 months in the middle of a project. I use this tool moderately and I expect a higher standard from dewalt's tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great when it works.
customer_reviews.text: It is light weight and does a good job until it doesn't fire repeatedly and screws up my new molding. Have to unjam it or screw around with the brads which are installed correctly and are dewalt brads. Then it will work again until it screws up again. I already had a cheap brad nailer. I wanted one that wasn't going to screw up my molding. Wishful thinking on my part I guess. Had psi set to 100 which sunk them perfectly when it worked. Was looking forward to having a nice working tool. Wish this brad nailer fit that description.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: ... read the reviews and purchased this unit as I like Dewalt products
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and purchased this unit as I like Dewalt products. The first one stopped working after about 3 strips of brads. The trigger would not reset. Amazon did a great job in replacing the unit with another Dewalt. I received it and to my amazement it stopped working after about 3 brad strips With the SAME problem. Again Amazon is wonderful on returns as this is my second return in 6 years. I will be purchasing another brad nailer but it will NOT be a Dewalt.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Handle filled with air
customer_reviews.text: I love Dewalt products. But this nail gun failed the first time I used it and that was not until after the cut off Amazon placed on this product for returns. The handle of the nail gun filled with air and leaks.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hardeman

customer_reviews.title: Defective on Arrival
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the project I needed this for got sidelined for several months, and I missed the return window. The item that was shipped to me was/is defective. The trigger does not cause the fun to fire. I had to rig it with a small piece of wood as a shim to bridge the connection between the trigger and the firing mechanism. Could just be a defective unit, but definitely ensure you test it upon arrival. An unfortunate expensive error on my part.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Good, but not perfect. Having several employees using 18g nailers, we have a decent idea of what works well. This one is decent, but it's a little jerky on the firing (harder to hold steady without applying a fair amount of pressure, marring surfaces slightly). Sets well, esp if you remove the yellow "cap". Overall doing a decent job tho, so will keep them.
customer_reviews.author: Dwegs

customer_reviews.title: DWFP12231
customer_reviews.text: The brand new Nail Gun did NOT work. However, I received a phone call from a Big Box Overstock Customer Service Representative and within minutes she made arrangements to ship a replacement unit and provided a discount for my troubles. Couldn't have asked for better service and concern from a retail business. I will always check out their web site before buying any other similar product. Thanks "Big Box Overstock" Great Job !!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great pin nailer
customer_reviews.text: Great pin nailer. Fires a brad every time. My Bostich brad nailer was about 50% success. The only issue is the holding power of the 18 gauge wire brads. Ok for trim but if you need any kind of structural holding, use a real nail. Also be wary of where you have your fingers. 18 gauge brads are so thin they will follow grain and shoot out of the project anywhere. Looks terrible and is painful if your finger is in the path. I bought this to assemble bird and bat houses made from cedar. Brads have insufficient binding grip. Went back to using 6d finish nails.
customer_reviews.author: Lost Scotsman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Awesome right out of the box. These new models don’t need oiled and do not jam but if they do you can open the front to get it out. Great quality. Ordered it and had it the next day. Thank you Prime.
customer_reviews.author: John Coulter

customer_reviews.title: Bad Quality
customer_reviews.text: I've had this gun for just about two years now. It has started to leak into the handle (blowing it up like a balloon) and more recently has started to leak from somewhere near the front. I am disappointed this tool did not last even two years. Especially because I have not been working it that hard. I will replace with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Carroll

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Wondering how I lived without this in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect ! Wondering how I lived without this in my tool collection. Works great, no complaints. Nice case too. Used it for about 300 feet of quarter-round installation.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Green

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: Great nail gun ,I'm a full time high end trim carpenter and have tried multiple 18 gauge guns and I now will only use dewalt, great quality and lightweight
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: Gun works great! It's a dewalt
customer_reviews.text: Gun works great! It's a dewalt. To the 1 star reviewer that said the pneumatic brad nailer did not say it needed compressed air. Look up the word pneumatic. It means by compressed air or gas. I don't think you should rate a product if you have not even used it !!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa K.

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even get through one set of nails. The head was leaking so bad it wouldn't keep air pressure up enough to use it. Would be happy to return it in exchange for another (I didn't first use it until after the official "return" date with Amazon), but got no response in the questions section. AVOID BUYING THIS NAIL GUN.
customer_reviews.author: AudK

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Nail Gun
customer_reviews.text: Bought the gun with the case only, got it in a couple of days and have been using it a couple of times a week. It is very easy to use and the controls are very intuitive. I used it a rough project where I didn't want the nails to be set and a finished project where I wanted the nails to be set so I could fill the pin holes (and I mean pin holes). It took less than 10 seconds of adjusting to get what I wanted both times. Highly recommend the nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Gary M. Cawn

customer_reviews.title: Great until it starts jamming
customer_reviews.text: Great nail 🔫 until it starts jamming. Started to jam halfway through installing a back board for our bed.
customer_reviews.author: Alden B Lee

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I have had this nailer for about 1 year, and it has worked flawlessly. The built quality/fit & finish are very nice, and all the moving parts feel solid and of high quality. The weight and balance are also good; it is nice to pick up and handle. It is simple to load, simple to access in case of a jam (which I don't recall having any so far), and overall I have nothing bad to say about it. Dewalt tools are a mixed bag these days, but each item should be examined on its own merits rather than under a brand name umbrella, and this one is top notch in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Clever Name Goes Here

customer_reviews.title: Check to see if works right after getting it.
customer_reviews.text: I waited to long to text this gun. When I connected it to an air hose it leaks. It can not even be used. It is probably a good gun otherwise but I will never know because I can not return it for a new one. My bad
customer_reviews.author: Gary.

customer_reviews.title: DWFP12231 brad nailer not up to Dewalt Standards
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke the first time I used it. Trigger does not work. No response from Dewalt as yet. Another Chinese POS
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Good price for air brad nailer.
customer_reviews.text: Nice air brad nailer! I used to remodel my kitchen. Worked well on using to attach trim for cabinets. Cost under $100.00 dollars. Found out when working with maple trim adjust air to 90 psi. Or you will split. For instance corner round.
customer_reviews.author: BAX

customer_reviews.title: Seems like it would work for 30 or so and then ...
customer_reviews.text: Used a Harbor Freight 18 gauge for years. It would work okay and then it would jamb. Using an allen wrench you would have to take the front plate off and yank out the stuck brad. Seems like it would work for 30 or so and then stop and take it apart. I had a job doing the baseboards for a large house so opted to upgrade to the Dewalt. Out of the box this gun sunk every 2" brad perfectly and not one jamb. If it did jamb it would have been a quick release lever in front to get the brad out. Really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S.

customer_reviews.title: Great Finish Nailer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to install shiplap on a large wall. Worked great! Super light weight and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Late night shopper

customer_reviews.title: Consistently High Performance  at  Very Reasonable Price
customer_reviews.text: Very well built. Easy to load stsples or brad nails. Light weight; very easy to maneuver. Holds up well under repeated use. All this for less than $80.
customer_reviews.author: michaelpaul50

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this on January Today was first time I had time to use. The quality does not compare to other Brad nailers that I have had for years. It leaks air from the front and therefore does not hold air. The box states 90 day return guaranteed. How can I return this nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Kithchen King

customer_reviews.title: Quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and no jams using quality nails.worked perfect on several home projects including installing shiplap planking on an inside remodel.i recommend this product for à handyman.
customer_reviews.author: Rickeevee

customer_reviews.title: Works great saving so much time.
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and easy to use. My husband loves it and loves the time it saves him. He bought to put up trim moulding in our home and it has been great for that. Durable product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: S Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Very happy to not be hammering anymore
customer_reviews.text: This was my first pneumatic tool, and it pairs with a Dewalt 15g compressor previously purchased. I have absolutely no complaints at all. The tool has worked perfectly to fasten brads. I'm not a professional wood worker or whatever, just home owner that dabbles in DIY projects and home repairs. I've used this to fix my panels on my fence, and to assemble wood boards/panels for various things. Very happy to not be hammering anymore. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Jon Disnard

customer_reviews.title: Service
customer_reviews.text: The first one I got would shoot w or 3 nails, then nothing for a while. Air pressure was fine and no jams. Called Dewalt service which was a total waste of time. He said I could send it to them for repair or replacement. It was brand new! Repair would be 6 to 8 weeks and replacement would take ed 8 to 12 months. Less than one star for them. Made a return with Amazon and the new on ed that works perfectly 2 days later. 5 stars plus for Amazon and the seller! Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great nailer
customer_reviews.text: Great nailer. Far better than my grip-right and much more powerful than the electric alternatives. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teacher Dad

customer_reviews.title: How to use it
customer_reviews.text: I am just using it. I like it and I use it to install new trim in my house. I did have a 20 year old Craftman Brad nailer that finally quit working and can't get parts anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use, new one is coming
customer_reviews.text: After it stopped working after only one use, I called the warranty office. They are supposed to be sending a new one. I am hoping thaT the new one will live up to the DeWalt brand reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Barbpeyt

customer_reviews.title: great purchase, quality product
customer_reviews.text: Needed a nailer to finish a DIY project, received quickly and helped us finish with ease. Husband was happy!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I used this a ton in the first few weeks that I got it. Its cheap and easy to use, great for molding or anything you need to put together.
customer_reviews.author: James Milton

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight Brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: Nice lightweight Brad nailer. Easy to use. Powerful. No problem sending 2" brads through different types of wood. I used the Senco nails. Nice depth setting. No air leaks. Very quiet and minimal kickback. Easy to clear jams even though I haven't had any jams. Also easy to see where the nail will be driven into the wood. Solid carry case. Should last for a long time. Standard 1/4" male industrial fitting at the bottom of the handle, so I suggest getting a female quick connect for easy connecting and disconnecting of air hose to nailer.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: A great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy a finish nailer since I only had a few projects planned. OMG this is amazing! I don't know why I waited so long to buy a pneumatic nailer. I purchased a couple of different length 18 gauge nails for different projects and I was not disappointed. It is hard to go wrong with this product. I would def recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: De Walt Brad Nail gun Kit
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product and outstanding quality. Arrived on time, came securely packed and a good priced. I highly recommend this product/ Seller.
customer_reviews.author: Evergreengirl🍃

customer_reviews.title: One of the best ones i had so far
customer_reviews.text: This tool is lightweight and easy to operate for a long period of time. Having used soo many nailguns, Dewalt is one of the best. Drive depth adjustment is a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Naylok

customer_reviews.title: Reliable
customer_reviews.text: Just remember you need to buy a compressor to use the item. Other then that, item was good. Easy to use and durable
customer_reviews.author: Darin Kaplan

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for my corner round job. Easy to use and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: jason

customer_reviews.title: Love Dewalt Quality and Performance
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt tools are wonderful, reliable, tough and this nailer is just what I wanted for my wood working hobby. Accurate, versatile and small and lightweight for me to work into some projects that would have been a pain to use a tack hammer. Only complaint is not about the tool or the sturdy case, but whomever I bought it from must have kept it in a cigarette friendly place. It still reeks of old cigarette smoke. but that does not inhibit the performance, just mine.
customer_reviews.author: Lifelong Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: I needed a brad nailer for a small project I was working on. I read the reviews and chose my favorite brand, DeWalt. It did not disappoint. This little gem will put in those brads with a feather touch. It took a little practice to make sure that the head of the brad was just under the surface. Once set, though, there was no looking back. It loads easily and is not noisy which is important to me. It is smooth and does not jerk in my hand. All in all, a great little package.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Very good little nail gun I Recommend it
customer_reviews.text: Very good nail gun I'm a trim Carpenter and I often have to use this gun for trim and other things we use this gun almost every day sometimes all day for 5 hours non stop just need to oil every day and blow any dust away and is ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work right
customer_reviews.text: You have to pull the trigger 3or 4time to get one pin too shoot. If my time wasn’t up a I would return it
customer_reviews.author: Gerald purvin

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS GOOD, REALLY GOOD
customer_reviews.text: I bought two brad nailers from Harbor Freight before I realized I was getting just junk. Both went bad within a few months. So I did what I should have done and stuck with Dewalt. And yes, as with all my Dewalt toys, I mean tools, they are the best. As they say, "You get what you pay for."
customer_reviews.author: R.. W. P., Inc.

customer_reviews.title: Great nail gun
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic tool! I wish these had been around years ago when I was a trim carpenter. I have been putting down base-shoe and it is so much faster and easier than a hammer. It is very lightweight and has not jammed yet on me either. Pneumatic nail guns are far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Helios and Neaira

customer_reviews.title: Easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use. No miss feeds or any hiccups. Top quality product!
customer_reviews.author: Patti M

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: My nailer arrived with a defective trigger valve. Rather than go through the hassle of sending it back, I ordered a new trigger and fixed it myself. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Robert F. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Broke after some months
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 9 months. Had to buy another one for work, no way to return or replace the broken one.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and leaves an almost invisible mark even ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my first brad nailer so I can't compare it to others but I read tons of reviews and this one seems to come out on top. Now I can't figure out how I lived without one. Easy to use and leaves an almost invisible mark even when face nailing. Quiet, and very low cost to operate. I just finished off a tongue and grove pine garage ceiling and was very pleased. I can't imagine how I might have fared without it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Dewalt 👍the best🤪.
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt tool r not a jock Best of the game . I love dewalt nail gun n compressor.
customer_reviews.author: efrain rbarajas

customer_reviews.title: Well priced and well made
customer_reviews.text: I needed an 18-Gauge finish nailer to complete a few projects I had started around the house including trim on a bunk bed, a mantle shelf for our front room, and a washer/dryer stand for our laundry room. This kit is ready to go right out of the box and does a great job allowing you to adjust the depth of your finish nails. The carrying case is also a great addition since there are times I just want to grab this, throw it in the truck and go help someone on their project.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce D.

customer_reviews.title: DeWalt is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Took out of the box and it was ready to go in less than a minute. Great quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: TMcC

customer_reviews.title: First one had a pressure leak
customer_reviews.text: The first one I ordered would not hold pressure. Had a leak in the piston. Was very disappointed that a DeWalt tool, being brand new would have such a defect. The replacement came in, so I tested it right away, and works wonderfully
customer_reviews.author: Tracy T Cook

customer_reviews.title: How’d I live without it?
customer_reviews.text: Finally broke down and purchased this trim nailer. I’m a once in a while do it your selfer and have always just hammered and nailed my trim in place. I can’t believe how fast and easy this things makes trim. If you’re on the fence on getting one... take my advice and just get it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: It Works for Us
customer_reviews.text: We're commercial beekeepers and used the Dewalt heavily through the spring to assemble thousands of frames. It met our needs with minimal, if any misfires. The safety tip, designed to prevent accidental firing, can be a little frustrating in tight spaces but, in all, it's probably better than having to dig a brad out of your body somewhere. We're very happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Miller

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this would have worked great, however got as a gift and the sender didn’t realize it required a compressor. It was returned with no issues, and we got a battery one at HD
customer_reviews.author: J & L

customer_reviews.title: Why wait
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to install baseboard, why did I wait so many years before getting a nail gun. Works like a dream, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Wild Hare1

customer_reviews.title: Versatility of product and ease of use is five star.
customer_reviews.text: I am able to use it when hubby lets me. Safe to use, very universal.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Kitzmiller

customer_reviews.title: good but not great tool
customer_reviews.text: Depth adjustment setting seems to change with use at times. Trigger safety sometimes requires repositioning the tool multiple times to allow trigger. loading is very easy. Removing jammed nail is quick and easy
customer_reviews.author: Richard K.

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE my nailer
customer_reviews.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE my nailer! I do a ton of wood working projects, and this little beast can hold up to all of them! With the ability to drive 5/8" to 2" brad nails, I have the option of using this same nailer for many projects. I have yet to have any hang ups or jams in this nailer. I am a brand loyal guy and Dewalt has yet to disappoint me.
customer_reviews.author: ddelgado42

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Have owned this gun for a while now and it works great. I'm partial to Dewalt tools and this one is really a good value that holds up very well. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gary1948

customer_reviews.title: How to get things finished...
customer_reviews.text: Need some trim to get put up... perfect gift to get it done! lol The nailer is easy to use, safety features prevent accidents - I gave it a go and was surprised that there is no recoil or vibration on your hand as you nail away. I guess I expected something... but pleasantly surprised, as easy as press, pull the trigger and the nail is in. No getting tired excuses from me, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: MrsKZY

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool. Used it for some crown molding
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool. Used it for some crown molding. Had to adjust the settings cause man it tore thru my headers!!! :) Must have tool....
customer_reviews.author: Scott Moore

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: I always use DeWalt power tools and this nail gun was no less impressive than usual. It has never failed. Shoots consistent. I had a Ridgid model previously and I would definitely stay with the DeWalt if given the choice. I use this with a DeWalk pancake compressor to great results.
customer_reviews.author: jtp0624

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My lefty husband loves this thing. It has held up for nearly a year now and it’s a very good price for a very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Banner

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love that Black & Yellow!
customer_reviews.text: You can't go wrong with a DeWalt product. This is beautiful lightweight air nailer
customer_reviews.author: Meghann Foley

customer_reviews.title: Great little Brad Nailer!
customer_reviews.text: I had an older off brand 18-gauge brad nailer that died. I have been slowly replacing my cheap tools with quality tool. I found this brad nailer from Dewalt and I have always liked Dewalt. I bought this and have used it for several months now. Never had a problem out of it and it preforms flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: SHAME ON AMAZON !!
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works very well. Light weight and easy to control. The major problem is that the one I received jamed every 3-5 shots which makes it useless as a tool and I was using DeWalts 18ga, 2in nails. It is going to be returned. SHAME ON AMAZON !!!! Turns out it was a USED, POSSIBLY DAMAGED item although it was supposed to be new. Even the nail box had been opened. I did order another one which was clearly new and it works fine. Still one or two jams, but that's after several lines of nails.
customer_reviews.author: GMAN

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Even though the nails are lighter guage thab my finish nailer, they still hold. Nice that it is easy to load.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Works like yopu expect
customer_reviews.text: Works like you expect from Dewalt. Safty trigger is a little touchie.
customer_reviews.author: American Trading Company

customer_reviews.title: An absolutely beautiful brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: We used this to replace window stops on an insulated glass unit replacement job. A fantastic precision nailer which is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: p663y

customer_reviews.title: Nice nailer. Built well
customer_reviews.text: Nice nailer. Built well, light and well balanced. Have only used it twice for small jobs but worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Leaks air
customer_reviews.text: I just received my brad nailer today and used it it leaks a lot of air out of where the nail comes out. My air compressor can't keep up.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Really like using Air nailer works great. I like the idea of not oiling. Replaced air nailer that had to be oiled. It was messy and didn't always fire. This one worked every time without the mess.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. Literally start working with it right out of ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. Literally start working with it right out of the box. This is great for small projects around the house and building boxed frames. Depth adjustments are really easy to set. Just have a test piece of wood ready to ensure you have the depth you want.
customer_reviews.author: Fox

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: Dewalt there stuff is not what it use to be
customer_reviews.author: Mark R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this brad nailer
customer_reviews.text: What's to say, its a Dewalt. Love this brad nailer, easy to load/use. And the case is a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt S

customer_reviews.title: Stopped Shooting Nails for No Reason
customer_reviews.text: Stopped Working after a year for no reason at all. I took it apart to check the O-rings and seals and nothing was broken or leaking. Spring was just fine while holding the nails in place.. Just decided it didn't want to shoot nails anymore. Can I send it back? I know DeWalt is supposed to be guaranteed products.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Sand

customer_reviews.title: Works like it should
customer_reviews.text: Read the instructions before you use it. It has a limit on the air pressure you can use.
customer_reviews.author: Sparrow120

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: Even though the directions for this were weird, it was a great purchase and it works great. My husband used it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Davis

customer_reviews.title: Broken right out of box
customer_reviews.text: The o-ring was leaking right out of the box so nailer was completely non-functional!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Finally have a chance to rate this Dewalt. We remodeled our kitchen, and had alot of trim to put back on after we laid new hard wood floors. This nail gun is awesome! Strongly recommend. Great price, easy to use, and even I feel great using it! I have several other upcoming projects I plan to use this for!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth

customer_reviews.title: First gun jammed up and broke after about 100 nails ...
customer_reviews.text: First gun jammed up and broke after about 100 nails. Prime replaced it and the second is going smoothly thus far. Kind of hard for a Dewalt product to break so quickly but this is the home owner version.
customer_reviews.author: Nate.G

customer_reviews.title: Best price
customer_reviews.text: Best price around for this exact part number and model. Very good quality and the variable depth setting that regulates brad depth is well calibrated.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan B.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This gun is just what I was looking for. I mention the brads for this gun and it is a wonderful thing to have around the house, wood shop and for all small jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Drennen Blocker

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used dewalt drills for years so I assumed this would be a legit product but I was wrong. I did the baseboards for a room and a bathroom probably a total of 100 nails and now it’s basically not working. It shoots one nail and then gets jammed. I have to clear it every time for it to work!!!
customer_reviews.author: Devin Cowardin

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into compressor and air leaked profusely from nail hole. Now I get to box it up and take it to a UPS store to send back. Thanks for nothing...
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Weaver

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have finish nailer gun. Happy I paid the exrtra money.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good nail gun. I bought this to replace my Craftsman 1-1/4 nailer. Slowly, I am replacing my Craftsman power tools with DeWalt type. There is no comparison. Love it Love it Love it! It even comes with an adapter that is the size that I use in my air system. Win Win! I am glad I paid the extra money. Sure, I could have purchase a nailer for less then half the price, but I didn't want to deal with nail jambs etc. Pay the extra money and make the project you at building less frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: F. Masters

customer_reviews.title: I used it a couple times and blew one of ...
customer_reviews.text: I used it a couple times and blew one of the gaskets inside that needed replacing. Keep the pressure at or below minimums or it will break
customer_reviews.author: Neil Dyer

customer_reviews.title: medium duty, not a heavy duty nailer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for my applications. light weight, accurate, good range of nail sizes, easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Donald D.

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed Wprks great. Been using it steady since I got it>
customer_reviews.author: baco-davi

customer_reviews.title: Great Nailer for a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old Craftsman braid nailer that could only hold 1 1/4" 18 gauge nails. The ability to use 2" nails for door and window casing is really nice. The Dewault nailer also does a much better job of punching the nail, leaving no shiners for the entire project (replacing every window and door casing in my entire house) I used it on.
customer_reviews.author: tickko

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: We used this nailer to assemble repurposed wood lanterns for family this past Christmas. The nailer was easy to use and save use lots of time and effort. It performed flawlessly regardless of nail lengths. Changing lengths of nails was also quick and easy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Judi Welsh

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for my buck
customer_reviews.text: Rented same model from home depot for what it cost me to buy it. Great for home use, trim, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jaison

customer_reviews.title: Wait and see.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a final review. Used the new nailer once and it jammed twice. Will see how it preforms and add to this evaluation.
customer_reviews.author: Tugly

customer_reviews.title: Great brad nailer.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this gun as a backup to another gun that has started jamming occasionally. It works great; it's now my preferred 18 ga gun. After a few thousand brads it hasn't missed one yet. It loads easy enough, has the power to set 2" brads in hardwood and has survived a couple of falls while installing crown molding.
customer_reviews.author: JimM

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I've used both 1.25 inch and 2 inch brads in the nailer, some Dewalt brand, some not. It has yet to jam or misfire, and it has been very durable. I've used it for both trim and moldings have yet to be disappointed. The magazine loads very easily. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Paul M.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this nailer
customer_reviews.text: I like how many difference size nails it holds. If you have never owned a nail gun and are trying to decide what to go with like I was before buying this, I would suggest this gun. I tend to overkill the research I do before buying a product and from what I read, this nailer was the best fit for me.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Porter

customer_reviews.title: Solid unit. Very much recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! The quick and easy nail brad jam system is perfect. That has always been my biggest frustration with other units. I've use 1 and 2" brads for trim, picture frames and floor molding. The unit works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: No Air Leaks
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pin nailer. Much quieter than my previous Porter Cable nailer. Fires the nail every time without jams. Loads easily. Comes with a quick connector installed but I use a less standard type so I had to change it. No air leaks!
customer_reviews.author: Allen

product_meta.title: DEWALT Brad Nailer Kit, 18GA, 5/8-Inch to 2-Inch (DWFP12231)
product_meta.description: Style:Brad Nailer KitThe new DEWALT DWFP12231 18 gauge, 2-Inch Brad Nailer Kit is an excellent tool with many enticing qualities. It features a long life maintenance-free motor to keep from staining the work surface. The magnesium body delivers a strong and lightweight design. It also features a tool-free depth -of-drive adjustment with detents for proper setting of nail heads, along with a tool-free jam release mechanism for easy nail removal. The rear exhuast helps to keep contaminates away from work. This unit is made to drive 18 gauge nails from 5/8" to 2" in length, with a sequential style trigger, and 100 nail magazine capacity. This unit has a removable non-marring nose tip with on tool storage, and an integrated rubber grip for improved comfort and anti-slip grip. It also has an adjustable belt hook which allows the tool to be kept near the user. This kit also includes carrying case and owner's manual. Refer instruction manual before use. A compressor is required and not included.
feature_bullets: Long life maintenance-free motor to keep from staining the work surface
Tool-free depth-of-drive adjustment with detents for proper setting of nail heads
Tool-free jam release mechanism for easy nail removal
Rear exhaust to keep contaminates away from work. Operating pressure 70 - 120 psi
Compressor is required to use this product but is not included
Drives 18 gauge nails from 5/8" to 2" length. Power Source: Pneumatic. Power Tool Type: Pneumatic. Note: There are no nails included
